info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:50PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central El Paso County through 230 PM MDT... At 149 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 5 mph. With recent rains from yesterday over Manitou Springs and moderate to heavy rainfall ongoing, enhanced streamflows are expected along streams, creeks, and rivers. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Western Colorado Springs and Manitou Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
